title: Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to Serious Human Rights Abuse and Corruption
summary: This notice from the Federal Register, dated December 10, 2025, announces the continuation of the national emergency concerning serious human rights abuse and corruption. This emergency was initially declared by the President on December 20, 2017, through Executive Order 13818, utilizing the International Emergency Economic Powers Act. The order cited the unusual and extraordinary threat posed by these abuses and corruption to the national security, foreign policy, and economy of the United States. The notice asserts that these threats persist, necessitating the continuation of the national emergency for another year beyond December 20, 2025, as per the National Emergencies Act.
